chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer
Throw/Discharge Bodily Fluid at Public Safety Worker or Prosecutor

result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Talise G. Matchopatow

records.addlTxt:
Clerk Micki 
Case called at 8:16a.m.
INCLUDES 20CM1256, 21CF1127, 21CF1479, 21CM790, and 22CF718

State appears by ADA Hannah Boeck; Defendant appears in person in custody from the MCJ, with Attorney Thomas Roley.

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.
COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding.

State moves to:
20CM1256
COUNT 2: Disorderly Conduct, Repeater >> DRI.
21CF1127
COUNT 2: Throw/Discharge Bodily at Public Safety Worker or Prosecutor >> DRI.
COUNT 3: Disorderly Conduct >> DRI.
21CF1479
COUNT 1: Bail Jumping - Felony >> DRI.
COUNT 2: Battery >> DRI.
COUNT 3: Bail Jumping - Misdemeanor >> DRI.
COUNT 4: Bail Jumping - Misdemeanor >> DRI.
22CF718
COUNT 1: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer >> DRI.
COUNT 2: Throw/Discharge Bodily at Public Safety Worker or Prosecutor >> DRI.
COUNT 3: Bail Jumping - Felony >> DRI.
COUNT 4: Bail Jumping - Felony >> DRI
COUNT 5: Resisting or Obstructing an Officer >> DRI.
COUNT 6: Bail Jumping - Misdemeanor >> DRI.
COUNT 7: Disorderly Conduct >> DRI.

COURT GRANTS.

PLEA to:
20CM1256
COUNT 1: Battery, Repeater >> NO CONTEST.
21CM790
COUNT 1: Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) >> NO CONTEST.
21CF1127
COUNT 1: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer >> NO CONTEST.

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty.

COURT ORDERS: 
20CM1256 - COUNT 1: SWH for 2 years probation, concurrent to all other probation; CONDITIONS: Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent; 3 months conditional jail, concurrent to all other jail; N/C with victim, B.A.I.; Restitution if requested (none requested); Maintain FTW/School or combination of the two; Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and controlled substances, unless prescribed and only to be taken as prescribed; Remit CC; and DNA sample and surcharge. 

21CM790 - COUNT 1: 2 months jail, concurrent to all other jail; Restitution in the amount of $439.98 plus 10% surcharge to Mill's Fleet Farm; Remit CC; and DNA sample and surcharge.

21CF1127 - COUNT 1: SWH for 2 years probation, concurrent to all other probation; CONDITIONS: Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent; 3 months conditional jail, concurrent to all other jail; Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and controlled substances, unless prescribed and only to be taken as prescribed; Remit CC; DNA sample and surcharge; and Restitution in the amount of $2,552.87 plus 10% surcharge to Cities and Villages Mutual Insurance Company.

55 days jail credit if revoked. 

ADJ: 9:05a.m.

*** THESE MINUTES WERE UPDATED ON 7/20/22 ***
Plea hearing on July 14, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Calendar call on July 7, 2022 at 08:05 am.

Clerk Micki.
INCLUDES 20CM1256, 21CF1127, 21CF1479, and 21CM790

COURT vacates previous bond forfeitures.  Reinstates all bonds as previously ordered.

No violent contact with victim(s): B.M.C.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept. Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (3) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

- Prints and photograph. 
- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release.  Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 3 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.
